metadata.author: pokemon
metadata.description: Pokemon Trading Card Game Base Set - Complete Set with Structured Effects

cards.name: Alakazam

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Damage Swap
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.description: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

cards.name: Blastoise

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

ability.name: Rain Dance
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.description: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

cards.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

cards.description: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

cards.name: Charizard

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

ability.name: Energy Burn
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.description: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

cards.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs.

cards.description: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

cards.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Dragon Rage does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

cards.name: Hitmonchan

attacks.name: Jab
attacks.text: Jab does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Special Punch
attacks.text: Special Punch does 40 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

cards.name: Machamp

attacks.name: Seismic Toss
attacks.text: Seismic Toss does 60 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Strikes Back
ability.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if Machamp is Knocked Out), place 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon. This power can't be used if Machamp is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.description: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

cards.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

cards.description: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

cards.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to use this attack. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo.

cards.description: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

cards.name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

cards.description: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

cards.name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

cards.description: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

cards.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.description: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

cards.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

cards.name: Venusaur

attacks.name: Solarbeam
attacks.text: Solarbeam does 60 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Energy Trans
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.description: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

cards.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

cards.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

cards.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

cards.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.description: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

cards.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Slash
attacks.text: Slash does 40 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.description: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

cards.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

cards.description: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

cards.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Energy Spike
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: Buzzap
ability.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card of that type (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 Energy. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.description: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

cards.name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

cards.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: A Pokémon that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

cards.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Slash
attacks.text: Slash does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

cards.description: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

cards.name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Aurora Beam
attacks.text: Aurora Beam does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

cards.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Pound
attacks.text: Pound does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

cards.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

attacks.name: Pot Smash
attacks.text: Pot Smash does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

cards.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Flare
attacks.text: Flare does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

cards.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

cards.description: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

cards.name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Vine Whip
attacks.text: Vine Whip does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

cards.name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

cards.name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

attacks.name: Super Psy
attacks.text: Super Psy does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

cards.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

cards.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

cards.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Tackle
attacks.text: Tackle does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

cards.description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

cards.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Fire Punch
attacks.text: Fire Punch does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

cards.description: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

cards.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

cards.description: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.

cards.name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Horn Drill
attacks.text: Horn Drill does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

cards.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

cards.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

cards.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

cards.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Conversion 1
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

attacks.name: Conversion 2
attacks.text: Change Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

cards.description: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

cards.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Bite does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded down to the nearest 10).

cards.description: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.

cards.name: Seel

attacks.name: Headbutt
attacks.text: Headbutt does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

cards.name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Bite does 40 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

cards.name: Abra

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Psyshock does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and Teleport to safety.

cards.name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

cards.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

cards.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: String Shot does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

cards.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Scratch
attacks.text: Scratch does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

cards.description: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

cards.name: Diglett

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Dig does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mud Slap
attacks.text: Mud Slap does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

cards.name: Doduo

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

cards.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Pound
attacks.text: Pound does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

cards.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If, during your opponent's next turn, an attack Knocks Out Gastly, Knock Out the attacking Pokémon.

cards.description: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

cards.name: Koffing

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

cards.name: Machop

attacks.name: Low Kick
attacks.text: Low Kick does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

cards.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Tackle
attacks.text: Tackle does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

cards.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

cards.name: Nidoran♂

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.description: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

cards.name: Onix

attacks.name: Rock Throw
attacks.text: Rock Throw does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Onix during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.description: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

cards.name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

cards.description: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

cards.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Gnaw
attacks.text: Gnaw does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

cards.description: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

cards.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

cards.name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Smash Kick
attacks.text: Smash Kick does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Tail
attacks.text: Flame Tail does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

cards.name: Rattata

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Bite does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

cards.name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.description: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

cards.name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.description: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

cards.name: Starmie

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Starmie in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Starmie.

attacks.name: Star Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

cards.name: Staryu

attacks.name: Slap
attacks.text: Slap does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

cards.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.

cards.name: Voltorb

attacks.name: Tackle
attacks.text: Tackle does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, they have zapped many people.

cards.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

cards.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

cards.name: Clefairy Doll
cards.description: Play Clefairy Doll as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Clefairy Doll counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Clefairy Doll has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Clefairy Doll is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Clefairy Doll.

trainerEffects.description: Play as a Basic Pokémon with special rules

cards.name: Computer Search
cards.description: Discard 2 of your other cards from your hand in order to play this card. Search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

trainerEffects.description: Search your deck for any card

cards.name: Devolution Spray
cards.description: Choose 1 of your own Pokémon in play and a Stage of Evolution. Discard all Evolution cards of that Stage or higher attached to that Pokémon. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

cards.name: Impostor Professor Oak
cards.description: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

cards.name: Item Finder
cards.description: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to play this card. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

trainerEffects.description: Retrieve a Trainer card from discard pile

cards.name: Lass
cards.description: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.

trainerEffects.description: Shuffle all Trainer cards from both hands into decks

cards.name: Pokémon Breeder
cards.description: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

cards.name: Pokémon Trader
cards.description: Trade a Pokémon card from your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show that card to your opponent, then shuffle your deck.

trainerEffects.description: Trade a Pokémon for one from your deck

cards.name: Scoop Up
cards.description: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

cards.name: Super Energy Removal
cards.description: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to play this card. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.

trainerEffects.description: Remove up to 2 Energy from opponent's Pokémon

cards.name: Defender
cards.description: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.description: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

trainerEffects.description: Get up to 2 basic Energy from discard

cards.name: Full Heal
cards.description: Your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

trainerEffects.description: Remove all status conditions from Active Pokémon

cards.name: Maintenance
cards.description: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to play this card. Then draw a card.

cards.name: PlusPower
cards.description: Attach PlusPower to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Pokédex
cards.description: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

trainerEffects.description: Look at top 5 cards and rearrange

cards.name: Pokémon Center
cards.description: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

trainerEffects.description: Remove all damage from your Pokémon
Discard all Energy from healed Pokémon

cards.name: Pokémon Flute
cards.description: Choose a Basic Pokémon card from your opponent's discard pile and put it onto his or her Bench. (You can't use this card if your opponent's Bench is full.)

trainerEffects.description: Put Basic Pokémon from opponent's discard onto their Bench

cards.name: Potion
cards.description: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

trainerEffects.description: Remove up to 2 damage counters (20 HP)

cards.name: Super Potion
cards.description: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to play this card. Remove up to 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

trainerEffects.description: Remove up to 4 damage counters (40 HP)

cards.name: Bill
cards.description: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Energy Removal
cards.description: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

cards.name: Gust of Wind
cards.description: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Potion
cards.description: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

trainerEffects.description: Remove up to 2 damage counters (20 HP)

cards.name: Switch
cards.description: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.description: Double Colorless Energy counts as 2 Colorless Energy. Double Colorless Energy can't be used to pay for Pokémon Power costs.

restrictions: Can't be used to pay for Pokémon Power costs

cards.description: Basic Energy card. Provides Fighting Energy.
